USA: Scopes Trial: High school teacher John T. Scopes was found guilty of violating Tennessee's Butler Act, for teaching human evolution in the classroom.
Nellie Tayloe Ross was elected Governor of Wyoming, becoming the first woman elected governor of a U.S. State.
WSM first broadcast the Grand Ole Opry.
Syria: Great Syrian Revolt: Revolts started against French rule.
Slovenia: Italian king issues a decree, which interdicts Slovene and Croatian language also at courts of justice.
Philippine: Radio station KZIB from Binondo, owned by Isaac Beck Inc., goes on air.
Indonesia: Birth of Pramoedya Ananta Toer. A sharp rise in world commodity prices brings prosperity to the Indies.
Germany: The last of the Locarno Treaties, under which France, Belgium and Germany settled their borders and pledged not to attack each other, was signed.
Cyprus: Cyprus became a British Crown Colony. Sir Malcolm Stevenson was made governor.
Cuba: By the Hay-Quesada Treaty, the U.S. recognizes Cuban sovereignty over the Isle of Pines.
Chile: After intense political agitation the Chilean Constitution of 1925 is adopted, only slightly less authoritarian than that of 1833. The Impuesto Global Complementario, a graduated income tax, is introduced.
Brazil: The Coluna Prestes movement is launched at a meeting in Foz do Iguaçu.
British explorer Percy Fawcett sent a last telegram to his wife, before he disappears in the Amazon.
Belgium: Annexation of Eupen and Malmedy to the Kingdom of Belgium.
Henri, Comte de Baillet-Latour is elected President of the International Olympic Committee
Australia: Australian federal election, 1925: Stanley Bruce reelected as Prime Minister.
Albania: Italy began to penetrate Albanian public and economic life.
